title: Print
inscribed: Inscribed, in plate, upper center: 16. em Livre. / C. P. S. C. M. / Desseins de Lambris Nouvellement inventé par le Sr. de Cuvilliés premier Architecte de S. A. S. E. de Baviere; lower center: Echelle de [scale] 4. Pieds.; lower: Se vend a Paris chez le Sr. Poilly ruë St. Jacques, a L'image St. Benoit, Avec Privilege du Roy, et chez l'auteur.; lower right: Cette decoration / pouroit servir pour une Salle a manger, / les Paneaux marquez A. et B. sont variez. / Gravé par C. A. de Lespilliez
provenance: From the Collection of Léon Decloux
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Interior niche with central fountain, flanked by putti and a vase, each on a pedestal. Large fountain resting on pedestal with masks. Fountain has nude female figure holding reins of a sea monster spewing water. Birds and satyrs decorate the upper portion of the fountain with reeds and other plants. Central female figure at top with arms raised spews water from mouth. In the sky, putto rides an eagle; above, grouping of fish, nets, eels, and a triton.

tombstone.epitaph:
Print.
Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1921-6-282-65.
